history.content:
Full description of rules are here: https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/degree-reqs/enrollment-policy

TL;DR: You can't do anything phase 1, but you can get on the waitlist during phase 2 and after the semester ends (and you declare) you will get priority over non-declared students.

___

Actually you can phase I upper divs (assuming you're 100% confident you will meet the GPA requirement, otherwise you will get 'purged'):
"We just found out that we have limited capabilities in Cal Central for limiting who can get onto the waitlist, so anyone and everyone can waitlist for upper div CS courses. HOWEVER, WAITLISTS WILL BE PURGED after we process major apps in June. So what does this mean? 


For students declaring this semester, our advice remains the same as above because we can't guarantee that there will be spots in the course. You may have a slight advantage on getting on the waitlist earlier, but until we purge the waitlist of non-EECS/non-CS Majors, waitlist lengths/positions won't really be accurate indicators of your chances of getting into the course." @1173

Full description of rules are here: https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/degree-reqs/enrollment-policy

TL;DR: You can't do anything phase 1, but you can get on the waitlist during phase 2 and after the semester ends (and you declare) you will get priority over non-declared students.

___

Actually you can phase I upper divs (assuming you're 100% confident you will meet the GPA requirement, otherwise you will get 'purged'):
"We just found out that we have limited capabilities in Cal Central for limiting who can get onto the waitlist, so anyone and everyone can waitlist for upper div CS courses. HOWEVER, WAITLISTS WILL BE PURGED after we process major apps in June. So what does this mean? 


For students declaring this semester, our advice remains the same as above because we can't guarantee that there will be spots in the course. You may have a slight advantage on getting on the waitlist earlier, but until we purge the waitlist of non-EECS/non-CS Majors, waitlist lengths/positions won't really be accurate indicators of your chances of getting into the course." @1173

Full description of rules are here: https://eecs.berkeley.edu/resources/undergrads/cs/degree-reqs/enrollment-policy

TL;DR: You can't do anything phase 1, but you can get on the waitlist during phase 2 and after the semester ends (and you declare) you will get priority over non-declared students.

children.subject: Does this major application processing also occur going from fall to spring?

history.content:
If I take my last pre-req, 70 this semester and declare, will I be able to phase 1 cs upper divs this semester and get into them? Or can I phase 2 them or have any kind of priority? 

Thanks!

Edit: I know that signing up for upper divs during phase 1 was possible for last semester but I thought that it was because of a bug in cal central. Can an instructor confirm that this will hold for this semester?
